```{r in-line code q26b}
# total respondents ----
q26b_num_answers <- meds2024_before_clean |>
  select(train_valid_split) |>
  count() |>
  pull()

# total not answer 1 or NULL ----
q26b_not1 <- meds2024_before_clean |>
  select(train_valid_split) |>
  filter(train_valid_split %in% c("2", "3", "4")) |> 
  # filter(!is.null(train_valid_split)) |> # didnt' work
  group_by(train_valid_split) |>
  count() |>
  ungroup() |>
  filter(train_valid_split != "1 (never)") |>
  summarize(n = sum(n)) |>
  pull()

# answered 1 ----
q26b_1 <- meds2024_before_clean |>
  select(train_valid_split) |>
  group_by(train_valid_split) |>
  count() |>
  ungroup() |>
  filter(train_valid_split == "1 (never)") |>
  summarize(n = sum(n)) |>
  pull()
```

::: {.callout-note}
## `r q26b_not1` / `r q26b_num_answers` respondents advanced to Question 26c
**`r q26b_not1` / `r q26b_num_answers` student respondents (`r ((q26b_not1/q26b_num_answers)*100)`%)** chose a familiarity level of 2 or greater â€“ these respondents were directed to answer Question 25b. `r q26b_1` respondents selected **1 (never)** in response to Question 26b and were jumped directly to Question 27 -- they are recorded as `NA` in Question 26c, below.
